chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A. Malueg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua A. Malueg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua A. Malueg was found guilty of Incest with Child by Stepparent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Charli
Case Called:  9:15 a.m.
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.

COURT address parties with documents that Court has received.
COURT notes PSI has been completed.
Atty Kronenwetter makes statement re: "Victim Statement" section of PSI. 

ADA Wetzsteon reads Victim Impact Statement. 
Argument.
Deft addresses Court.
COURT gives ruling.

COURT ORDERS:  16 years Prison (8 years IC & 8 years ES) CONDITIONS of ES: NO Contact with anyone under the age of 18, unless approved by agent; NO contact with A.J.M.W.; Sex Offender Treatment; Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by Agent; No dating or sexual relationships unless approved by agent; Compliance with WI Sex Offender Registry; CC to be paid out of prison wages and remainder to be paid on ES; DNA Sample and Surcharge. 

COURT orders deft is NOT eligible for CIP OR SAP.
COURT orders 615 days jail credit.
COURT advises counsel to keep PSI confidential. 
Deft is remanded to WI State Prison System.

ADJ: 10:16 a.m.
Letter to Counsel Enclosing PSI
Transcript of Direct Exam of Dawneen Schueller on 03-09-2016
from Motion hearing on 3/7/16
Sentencing hearing on May 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Exhibits 1-4
Jurors Questions (SEALED)
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 1 - Not Guilty
Transcript of A.W. Testimony during Jury Trial on 3/8/16- Judge Greg Grau; Prepared by Mary Hader.

Clerk Cheree
State appears by DDA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Jay Kronenwetter; Bailiffs John and Jane Reid.
JURY TRIAL - DAY 3

Case called: 8:18am (Outside presence of jury)
State notes edited transcript marked as Exhibit 1; Atty Kronenwetter states agreement with video/transcript; State requests transcript be published to jury during playing of video - Argument by Atty Kronenwetter; COURT makes rulings.
8:22am - Jury reconvenes; COURT questions jury re: outside information about trial since court recessed yesterday - all jurors answer in negative.

Jennifer Plisch (Child Advocacy Center) sworn and testifies.
COURT gives instruction to jury regarding video.
8:40am - Video of CAC interview played to jury; 9:15am - Jury recesses; Parties discuss transcript; COURT recesses for break.
9:32am - COURT/JURY reconvenes; Copies of transcript provided to jury for review, and instructed to return them to bailiff when each is completed reviewing the transcript.
9:44am - COURT reads instruction on transcript/video; Testimony of Jennifer Plisch continues.
9:53am - JURY recesses; Parties make argument regarding testimony; 10:06am - JURY reconvenes; Testimony of Jennifer Plisch continues.
10:16am - JURY recesses; State notes their case in chief is completed and COURT recesses.
10:32am - COURT reconvenes (outside presence of jury); COURT holds colliquy with defendant regarding his decision to testify; COURT finds defendant makes decision freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
10:37am - Jury reconvenes; State rests; Joshua Malueg sworn and testifies.
10:58am - Jury recesses for parties to make arguments on testimony; Atty Kronenwetter moves COURT to instruct jury that State has violated discovery rules - COURT questions Atty Kronenwetter re:request and State responds; COURT makes rulings; COURT recesses 11:32am; COURT reconvenes - 11:39am; State notes defense has referenced 2 witnesses would be called and State objects to witnesses not being provided; Argument by counsel; COURT makes rulings.
11:43am - Jury reconvenes; Testimony continues.
11:52am - JURY recesses; COURT directs counsel to be in chambers at 12:15pm for jury instruction conference; COURT recesses 11:56am
1:17pm- COURT reconvenes (outside presence of jury); State and defense have no more witnesses; Both parties have reviewed proposed jury instructions and verdict forms and both are agreed upon.
1:20pm - JURY reconvenes; Defense rests; Closing arguments by State.
1:58pm -  Closing argument by Attorney Kronenwetter; 2:25pm - Rebuttal closing by State.
3:23pm - COURT reads instructions to jury; 2:50pm - Remaining alternate juror randomly chosen and thanked/excused by COURT; 2:54 Bailiffs sworn - JURY recesses to deliberate.
3:50pm - COURT reconvenes (outside presence of jury); COURT advises that jury has question that has been written down and given to bailiff - COURT reads to parties, and advises parties of response - both parties agree. Bailiff delivers answer and response received that jury wishes to read transcripts in open COURT; 4:02pm - Another note received by JURY that transcripts are now not needed; COURT recesses. 
6:45pm- Jury has reached verdict; Jury enters courtroom; Bailiff delivers verdicts to COURT; COURT reads verdicts.
Ct. 1>>NOT GUILTY
Ct. 2>>GUILTY
COURT polls each individual juror - each juror states they were and are their verdicts; COURT advises jurors they
State moves to enter judgment on Ct. 2 - Atty Kronenwetter moves for Not Guilty being entered on Ct. 2; COURT finds defendant GUILTY of incest with Child by Stepparent, and Ct. 1 is dismissed by COURT.
State requests PSI be prepared and bond be revoked - Atty Kronenwetter makes statement; COURT revokes bond and PSI ordered.

Judicial Assistant with be in contact with parties to set sentencing in approximately 60 days.
Adj: 6:53pm

Clerk Cheree
State appears by DDA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Jay Kronenwetter; Bailiffs John and Jane Reid.
JURY TRIAL - DAY 2

Case called: 9:37am (Outside presence of jury)
State notes changes in CAC video/transcript - Parties request COURT address at a later time today; COURT will address before lunch break.
9:40am - JURY reconvenes; COURT questions jury regarding any outside information obtained since trial recessed yesterday - All jurors answer in negative.
Testimony continues.
Detective Shane Heilmann (EMPD) sworn and testifies.
Dawneen Schuller (guidance counselor) sworn and testifies; 10:32am - Jury recesses for argument on objection - COURT makes rulings; 10:41am - JURY reconvenes and testimony continues.
10:54am - COURT directs jury to report back to jury room by 1:15; COURT admonishes jury not to discuss case; JURY recesses.
State addresses redacted transcript - parties agree to substitute corrected transcript as Exhibit 1 and COURT grants.
State addresses jury instruction prior to video being played for jury -- COURT recesses for parties to discuss; BOTR: 11:00am - (Outside presence of Jury) - proposed jury instruction addressed re: redactions in video; COURT grants agreement - COURT recesses 11:05am.
BOTR: 3:15pm - COURT reconvenes; State notes new edited version of video is now being prepared; COURT notes plan is jury to appear by 8:00am and trial to recommence tomorrow at 8:15am
JURY reconvenes 3:18pm - COURT explains to jury that delay is because of technology problem and jury will recess for today; COURT directs jury to return to jury room at 8:00am, and COURT admonishes jurors not to discuss case; JURY/COURT recess 3:22pm.
Jurors Selection and Peremptory Challenges (List of sworn jurors)
M.A.M.- Unserved.
and Certificate of Appearance; M.M., Personal Service for 03/08/2016- 03/10/2016.

Clerk Cheree
State appears by DDA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Jay Kronenwetter; Bailiffs John and Jane Reid.
JURY TRIAL - DAY 1

9:22am - COURT calls case - Juror Panel is ready per bailiff.
9:25am- Juror Panel enters; 9:30am - Juror Panel is sworn; COURT introduces case.
9:32am - State and defense introduce witnesses.
9:35am - Voir dire by COURT; 9:43am -COURT conducts individual voir dire on individual juror in chambers open to the public.
9:54am - COURT reconvenes in courtroom, Voir dire continues. Juror seated #15 C.J.J. struck for cause by COURT, replaces by juror seated #24 R.M.U.; Juror seated #9 G.W.A. struck for cause by COURT, replaced by juror seated #25 R.F.J.
11:08am - Individual voir dire conducted on two individual jurors in chambers open to the public; BOTR in courtroom 11:33am, Voir dire continues.
COURT directs parties to go to jury assembly area downstairs at 1:15pm after returning from lunch - COURT admonishes Juror panel not to discuss case while on break.
12:10pm - COURT/JUROR PANEL recesses; 1:38pm - COURT reconvenes - Bailiff notes that Juror #17 has a family emergency and is asking to be excused at this time - COURT Directs bailiff to excuse #17 at this time, then seat the next juror.
1:40pm - COURT excuses Juror seated #17 R.A.H. and replaced by #26 R.D.S.; Voir dire by Attorney Kronenwetter.
2:02pm - COURT thanks and excuses jurors behind rail; COURT orders counsel to strike jury list.
2:17pm - COURT reads list of jurors chosen to hear case; COURT thanks and excuses juror not chosen.
2:20pm - Jury sworn and COURT gives preliminary jury instructions; 2:30pm - COURT/JURY recess for break.
2:54pm - COURT/Jury reconvenes; Opening statement by State; 3:01pm - Opening statement by Atty Kronenwetter.
COURT notes notetaking is allowed and advises jury on notetaking; Testimony begins.
A.W. sworn and testifies - identifies defendant; Exhibits 2 and 3 published to jury.
3:44pm - COURT/Jury recesses BOTR: 3:52pm - COURT/Jury reconvene - Testimony continues.
4:23pm - COURT admonishes Jury not to discuss case; Jury to report back to Br. 4 jury room by 9:15am tomorrow; Jury recesses.
COURT notes parties have discussed that Atty Kronenwetter will be at DA's office at 8:15am to view excised recording.

State makes argument on record/going forward on JT.

COURT recesses - BOTR: 4:01pm
Parties address transcript of recording and redactions; COURT makes rulings.

COURT addresses MIL filed by State re: both issues - Atty Kronenwetter does not object; COURT grants both.

COURT questions parties if the trial will likely go into 4th day - State and Atty Kronenwetter believe that 3 days will suffice for this case.
COURT questions parties re: information on specific intimate part as to counts - Parties have not come to agreement, and COURT will wait until testimony is through.
